page.title: 01Gazeteer
page.content: Abergavenny is in the county of Gwent on the edge of the Brecon Beacons National Park.It is at the confluence of the Usk and Gavenny and it is a nodal point where routes meet.The A40 leads to Brecon and via Raglan, Gloucester and Oxford to London.The A4042 leads to Pontypool and the A465 to Hereford.The Heads of the Valleys road leads to Merthyr and on to Swansea The main market for livestock and produce is on Tuesday and the town is very crowded.There is a smaller market on Friday and on Thursdays auctions are held in the Market Hall.Early Closing is Thursdays.There are large free car parks.The carnival takes place in June and in May and September fairs come to the town. The population is 9600.
